text:
I use mod_rewrite in Apache (1.3.19) to rewrite some URLs before passing them
to Tomcat via mod_jk.

mod_jk.c in tomcat 3.2.2 uses the 'unparsed' URI from the request structure:

    s->req_uri      = r->unparsed_uri;

This means that any rewriting done by mod_rewrite is thrown away!  I know there
is a reason for the change from r->uri but is there any workround for my new
problem?
creator: rde@webtrak.co.uk

text:
Yes, we are aware of the problem, the fix is tricky ( due to the requirement to
return 'unparsed' uri on some servlet methods ). We're trying to find a
solution.
creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text: I believe Henri's recent fix resolves this problem, you have now the option to use the normal uri.
